summary.p: Thanks for Bullinger's ["The Christian Marriage"]. Otherwise, there is nothing to write; he hopes for good news from the Bundestag [in Schmalkalden]. His wife [Anna] also thanks for the book; they intend to heed its teachings. Greetings.

div.p: I give you as many thanks as I can for your little book; such gifts from such friends are most welcome to me. If only I could repay your many services to me. I await an opportunity, which, when presented, I will not be ungrateful.
I have nothing else to write. Everything is now silent concerning the business of the Gospel. If only we could hear good news from our assembly!
Farewell, my brother, and always pray for us. March 10, 1540.
My wife also thanks you for the gift; we will read it together and strive, aided by your exhortations, to become better.
Greet your entire household most diligently. I send my regards to Leo, Pellican, and all the brothers.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, churchman of Zurich, his dearest brother. Zurich.
